prompts.en: Travel back to the year your were conceived (not born) by your parents: just from memory, what was that year/time/era about? What was important in the realms of culture, history, politics, sports, economy etc.? Refrain from Googling, it is more interesting what you remember.
prompts.es: Viaja al año en que fuiste concebido (no en el que naciste) por tus padres: solo de memoria, ¿de qué se trató ese año/época/era? ¿Qué era importante en los ámbitos de la cultura, la historia, la política, los deportes, la economía, etc.? Abstente de buscar en Google, es más interesante lo que recuerdas.

userWritings: <Bueno en el año que nací, la política era un fraude como actualmente, la cultura...no estaba mal , era una cultura rica en lectura y gastronomía. Pero, la economía estaba en mal momento, aun estaban las pesetas.. pero la malversación de fondos... provocaba la pobreza en los trabajadores humildes. Los deportes una forma de tener a la gente engatusada, desviando las miradas y teniendo la mente ocupada en algo superfluo en vez de aprovechar el tiempo para conocerse a uno mismo saber en el mundo que vive, el mundo del deporte es otra organización. No recuerdo mucho la verdad, pero depende de la zona donde nazcas la mayoria de las cosas es totalmente diferente. Cambia mucho toda la v

I have no idea what was it about, but i am sure it was so different to life as we experience it today... no technology . no screens. no distractions in many forms as we encounter todas. I am always fascinated by the fact  that the world has changes so much in this las 35 years (my life) compared to for example 200 years back. Everything has accelerated. It is very intriguing for me. In those times people for sure spent more time actually doind and creating than today. Every thing and act had a more mid long term view. As life was not so fast an immediate as it is nowadays. Today life is really accelerated. Really fast. Data really travels fat with technological evolution. And in those times ... it was still not there. No cellphones, no computers. Nothing. Lots of machines but heavy machines. For helping with farming, every day life things that we humans do to survive and coexist as society. I am comparing all the time ... of course inevitable. Because this is what i know and remember more. I did not experience those times. At least what

i was born in 1991. i was conceived in 1990. i don't have a clue about what was happening in the realm of politics. i don't have a clue about what was happening in sports. i don't have a clue about what my parents cared about when they conceived me.

lo único que aparece son críticas hacia ellos. críticas que me hacen pensar que su atención no estaba dispuesta en mí lo suficiente. siempre queriendo esa atención. siempre explorando esa atención. siempre absorviendola. desde el momento en el que me enfrento a esta pregunta de esa forma, ya estoy construyendo en mi experiencia la necesidad de atención que se manifiesta tan expresamente en todo momento de mi vida.

no sé cómo lidiar con ella. no sé por dónde empezar. no sé cómo dejar de querer atención. simplemente puede ser un buen camino dejar el control. soltar el control. abrazar el control. desde lo que hay acá, desde este momento, y recordando que todo lo que hay es un regalo. que todo lo que viene es un regalo.

que toda la vida que tengo es un regalo. que no necesariamente hay que hacer sentido de este regalo. no necesariamente tengo espacio para abrazarlo.

y que está bien. está todo bien. todo lo que hay adentro está bien. todo lo que se expresa, está bien. todo lo que se manifiesta, está bien.

cómo se veía el mundo en 1990? qué es lo que estaba pasando? 

la verdad es que tengo un entendimiento absolutamente básico de esto. no tengo idea. no tengo dirección. no tengo por dónde entender. por dónde abrazar.

no sé qué es lo que viene. no sé qué es lo que está. lo que se abraza. lo que se absorve. lo que se encuentra.

es necesario enfocar la energía. y en este momento ese es el lugar dónde se pone el foco. en el hecho de que no tengo idea cómo era el mundo que me recibió. no tengo idea qué es lo que estaba pasando. no tengo idea qué era lo que había. no tengo idea de qué es lo que está acá.

no sé. no sé

The year I was born was 1989, my parents were of the young age of 18 years old in the case of my mom. My dad was 21. They were actually friends before they started dating, and when my dad moved to a new state for college, my mom went with him. I ultimately came about shortly thereafter. My birth experience was a tumultuous one, as my mom puts it: " I had reservations about joining humanity from the womb" as the doctors had to do an emergency c-section to prevent me from strangling myself with my umbilical cord on the way out (breach baby). My mom was overburdened with many things that they were not equipped to handle yet, my dad being one of those burdens. They thought they loved it each other, and maybe they did... That year is mostly a mystery to me, as I usually focus most of my energy on the things that I can do each day to improve the lives of the people around me. I feel like, had I been born 35 years before I was, I would have actually been born into a more productive timeline for my skillset and concepts. Not th

No recuerdo mucho de esa época, n había nacido aún, si  sé que era en los años 80. Buena época de rock, buena música, eso sí recuerdo. Grupos de glam rock, largas cabelleras. Política nunca me interesó mucho ni llamó la atención, creo que desde antes de nacer no era lo mio. Sé por una cuestión de calendario que igual en Chile había un sujeto que a muchos no les gustaba. Que más, estoy segura que hubo mucho amor, mis padres se aman mucho hasta el día de hoy, es admirable como se cuidan y respetan a pesar de sus cositas cotidianas como en cualquier pareja, pero llevan juntos 45 años. Y me encanta como mi papá le prepara el desayuno a mi mamá cada mañana y como mi mamá se preocupa de que mi papá esté bien. Son una gran pareja y siento que siempre nos dieron mucho amor a mi y a mis hermanos. Una familia unida y cariñosa. Talvez no muy expresiva en cosas profundas, per

y qué pasa si no recuerdo nada? qué es lo que estaba pasando en ese momento? mi memoria no existe. mi memoria no está. mi memoria no procesa. mi memoria está en blanco. mi memoria desaparece. mi memoria no quiere darme señales. 

y hay una eterna crítica adentro mío. será culpa de todo el alcohol que tomé cuando estaba creciendo? será culpa de toda la marihuana que fumé? será culpa de que realmente no me interesa tener memoria?

pero qué es uno sin memoria? de dónde viene la memoria? qué es lo que nos hace acordarnos? qué es lo que nos hace estar? qué es lo que nos hace traer?

qué es la memoria? de dónde viene? qué es lo que trae a nosotros?

no sé qué es lo que estaba pasando en el año 1990. no sé qué es lo que el mundo traía.

con suerte sé qué es lo que estaba pasando cuando nació mi hija. con suerte sé qué es lo que estaba pasando cuando vino al mundo mi hija. cuando la concebimos. y ahora tengo que volver atrás 33 años. y proyectar qué es lo que estaba pasando ahí.

no sé qué estaba pasando ahí. no sé qué es lo que traía eso. no sé hacia dónde iba. no sé qué era lo que traía. no sé qué es lo que hay.

no sé qué hay adentro. no sé con qué me encuentro. no sé donde explorar. no sé qué invitar. no sé donde atravesar. no sé con qué encontrarme. no sé hacia dónde avanzar.

así que avanzo hacia adentro, hacia la exploración del año en el que nací. mi hermano tenía dos años. la misma edad que tiene mila en este momento. es como si yo concibiera al hermano de mila en este momento. hoy. y ese ser en 32 años más se preguntara:

cómo era el año 2024? qué es lo que estaba pasando?

pero me preguntaron a mi.

y no sé. no lo tengo claro. no tengo idea. no sé por dónde empezar. no sé qué explorar.

no sé cuál es la invitación que me trae. pero acá estamos, explorando aunque no haya espacio.

Estaba Honeker en la RDA, aún existia el muro de Berlin, Estaba aún la Union Sovietica con Gorbachov. En Chile aun había dictadura con el dictador Pinochet. La musica en Chile no era libre.  En deportes estrella del tenis Becker, en el patinaje en Hielo, Katherina Witt. Yo escuchaba musica en casette, aún existían el marco aleman. el franco francés, Charles Costeau, He-man, el BArco del Amor, los anegeles de charlie version original. LA tele en

Thinking back, so much has changed from my parents time. Looking that far back feels like peering down into a deep pool, to see another world. A lot was the same, too - still war, still poverty, still fear, still shame. Is it worth saying that love mattered back then, too? It did. Love seems to blossom no matter what; even in dark days and times. It may be an inevitability. It seems as if the colour of the world has changed too, and is no longer coloured with tints of orange, moss green, the colour of my father's shirts, the colour of my mother's shoes. Did they stop wearing them? Did the colours cease?

1984 was all about big hair, and understanding more aspects of New Age. More people were  becoming "awake" or so they thought they were. This is what gurus and religious leaders would have you think anyway. Like every era, there was a desire for peace and there was also constantly wars on the horizon. After the 70's and the Vietnam war, we were supposed to have learned. But nothing changed. Sure people   knew how to sing Hare Krishna, but the confusion of humanity continued. The 80's were a time of terrible music and style.  I think I liked Kiss. Though I only learned about them 10 years later or so - where my Mom would accuse me of being a satan worshiper. I've always avoided poliitcs so I really have no clue what was happening in the 80's. What I do

this is madness. i don't know where to go. i don't know how to process all of the information that is inside me. i don't know how to deal with it. i don't know how to experience it. how to explore it. how to manifest it. how to embrace it. how to love it.

i don't know how to love it, and the question that revolves around my whole existence is:

am i a loser?

I AM A FUCKING LOSER.

i hate myself. and that is what comes over and over again. i have demonstrated myself that i don't know how to deal with this thing. i don't know how to process this thing. i don't know what it takes. what it takes. what it brings. i just run in circles, and i don't know where these circles end. i feel trapped inside the circles. i don't know where to move with the circles. i don't know how to embrace the circles. i don't know how to process the noise that comes from the circles. i don't know how to be alive through the circles. how to live with the circles. how to embrace them. how to live with them. how to manifest them. how to come up with new ways of living through them. it is all noise. it is all just noise. it is noise and it won't allow me to move forward. the noise won't allow me to move forward. it is just too much.

all of this is just too much. and i don't know how to experience it. i don't know how to live through it. how to embrace it. how to come up with new ways of being alive with it. i jump, from side to side. i embrace, from side to side. i come up with new ways of being, from side to side. and i'm tired. i'm fucking tired of this. i'm fucking tired of running in circles. of working in this. with this. of coming up with new ways of embracing this. i don't know where to go. i don't know how to go. i don't know how to experience.

so i run. i run in the maze. and i don't know how the world was when i was born. i don't know how this is alive. how this is manifested.

i don't know where to move with it. it is poison. it is all poison for the soul. my soul is poisoned, and i don't know where to move with it. i don't know how to keep going. i don't know if i want to keep going. this doesn't make sense anymore.

The era I was conceived in was right before the dot com bubble. Britney Spears had just taken over as the pop start icons. Houses in the United States were affordable to everyone who was able to make a pay check. Tom Brady had just entered the nfl. The economy had never looked better. 

This was as a result of a few things. First, the us had recently struck a deal with china to begin outsourcing manufacturing jobs. Products became cheap and accessible to everyone. Second, the personal computer was just introduced and productivity began growing per man working hours. Third, Wall Street began financial engineering with hedge funds and private equity firms. Warren buffet had just discovered deep value investing. 

All of these factors coupled together with no real threat to

Damals war es üblich verheiratet zu sein wenn man Kinder bekommt , deswegen haben meine eltern geheiratet ohne wirklich für eiunander gut gewesen zu sein. I was conceived in 1975, this is when the hippy revolution had swapped over to germany, my parent lived in a 'commune' where they had sex with many people and took drugs, pretty much daily. Drop-out culture. The world was divided into the WEST and the EAST, the latter combined 25-30 countries around the Soviet Union, and they were kept behind the so-called iron curtain. Music-wise, it was Disco, Giorgio Moroder, who I love, and I think Punk Rock, Glam Rock started to make a dash. The economy was post-war steady state, globalization had not quite yet started, the EU was called EEC I think, European Economic Council or so. Countries in Europe had proper boarders with controls. The controls between western and eastern european countries were very strict. In terms of German art, this was the height of artists like Joseph Beuys who 'extended' the definition of what art is e.g. a piece of fat in a p

It's the same year. ,, y es el año que pasó por acá el cometa Halley, por eso digo que me trajo el cometa y probablemente me vaya con el cometa... quedan unos 40 años antes de hacer mi viaje interestelar a otra galaxia en el buen cometa Halley. Siempre que preguntan en que año nací, digo "en el año del cometa" ... me parece divertido decirlo así. Pero rara vez digo que me iré con el cometa, es casi una broma interna. Esta es, de hecho la segunda vez que lo expreso, y creo que también fue escrito la primera vez; en un chat. En ese año también la película más taquillera fue la de Alien, probablemente la 1, no estoy muy segura de cuál de todas. Lo que me recuerda que no he visto Covenant, ¿ya salió otra?... No puedo googlear ahora. Qué interesante no poder googlear ahora. Tener que aguantar. El problema es que si no lo hago ahora se me va a olvidar. Pero sí estoy segura que me trajo el cometa. De eso no hay duda. ¿A tí quién te trajo? ¿Un cometa también? Sería divertido saber quiénes de nosotros hemos nacido en un año en los que ha habido avispamientos de cometas en nuestro planeta. Y también sería interesante saber cuánto tiempo me queda, yo pensaba que sería poquito y resulta que no... ahora mi hija grita desde la regadera que le ponga el shampoo y el jabón, pero no puedo ir... lololol, nimodo que me espere, creo que quedan 2 minutos. Cuando estaba siendo concebida, el planeta palpitaba de cambios politicos. Está  dominando una era capitalista a nivel mundial con el derrumbe el símbolo de la Unión soviética. 
Simultáneamente en Chile, se acababa por fin la dictadura militar de Pinochet, la más cruel de las dictaduras de sudamérica. 
Nací en una epoca de cura social, en la que la energia estaba dedicada a ocultar, y en otros casos enfrentar traumas. Estaba la oscuridad más profunda de los corazones de esta sociedad rota, al mismo tiempo que una luz de esperanza, libertad y un mundo mejor que el que les tocó vivir. Muchas lecciones comenzaron a desatarse, y el ambiente optimista todavía era muy efímero y pasajero, al lado del dolor colectivo que se había provocado por todos estos anos. 
El opacamiento y renacimiento de la hermosa cultura musical, pensante y critica de estos humanos que habitan la cordillera de los andes,
Finalmente la esperanza y un

It was in the Soviet Union. somewhere not far from the moment when Just The Two Of Us came out. my parents went to teh same university and were both construction engeneers. It was a tough time, but hope wasin the air. the music, the vibes, Siberian streets, winter full of snow, summer full of sweat. Grandma had a garden. Grandpa had a plot of land out of town where my dad staerted building a house for all of us. it was a house of white brick. they had apple trees in the garden. i later tried those apples, they were delicious, their skin transparent. grandma called the type Ambrosia, but they are so different nowadays in the markets of north america. life was also difficult and dad was in the army just before. they managed to see each other when he figured out how to run away and come back without being noticed. be gees, jesus christ superstar. dance parties. dad had long hair, he cut before i was born. it was black. he liked to perform on stage. but who was in power? likely Leonid Brezhnev, who could not properly speak by that time, but the people pretended to understand him, they pretended that everything was good. things werent bad per se. and when i was conceived, it was likely planned. planned economy. no checks or balances. at least there was a garden with potential apples and apples we did eat, when the time arrived. it arrived. uyes

Recordando el año en el cual nací en 1989 lo primero que se me viene a la mente es un periodo de transición y de cambios. Recuerdo una era análoga con poca tecnología en comparación a la revolución que vivimos hoy en día. 
Un periodo de transición tanto en lo político, cuando termina el régimen de Pinochet y tomando el mando Aylwin comenzando nuevamente un periodo de transición y en este caso de tratar de sanar. Por otro lado recuerdo de manera muy poco clara el cambio en la música, escuchando música chilena y éxitos muy repetidos en la casa de mis padres y familiares, música que comenzó a aumentar en su variedad y países de la mano de MTV y los programas de televisión. Recuerdo una época más sana, de mucha vida al aire libre y

The time I was conceved was a good time the country I was born. It was just after a big inflation event began becoming under control, so a lot of people were able to live the lives they wanted to. They were able to buy houses like my parents did. They were able to buy a house that I lived in from the time I was 3 until I left for collage. That one house gave me a lot of stability throughout life. Most people don't know what it is like to not move while they are growing up. It is deffentently something I like to think about. The other things happening, were related to my dads favorite sports team. They had had a bad run of luck, but were at the point were they had all the tools they would need to make the big run that I remember. My dad and I had a very tight bond built by baseball. It all started with me watching his favorite team, which then became mine. That common bond also allowed us to spend a ton of time together, since he was my coach while I was a kid. It was also a big thing we

I was very fortunate to have been conceived in a relativity good time in my country. There is a large portion of the goodness being derived from the fact that I was born with the "preferred" race and sex for the majority the populous in my area. I never realized how many benefits I had compared to other, just because of the random genetic lotter I was given. Now that I realize it, I am also very tankful that my parents instilled a nature in me that allowed me to realize that while I was given benefits, they were not given based on merit, so I should use them and help those that need it. The time was also an interesting time for the world. I believe it was when the wall came down. While that didn't affect me so much, it did show some progress for humanity. superPrompt:
<instructions>

Using all of the information on <day two>, <style>, <characters>, <setting>, and introduction, write the first chapter of the first book of anky.
This first book will speak about the first 7 years of the life of our character, and this first chapter will show us in parallel the life of his parents.
Your mission is to showcase to the reader how does the life of these two characters look like. What do they care about? What does their life look like? How does this life that they are living in this moment a reflection of all the circumstances that Anky will go through on his life?
The first chapter should come from the point of view of a narrator that is describing how they live their life. The special of the mundane.
Focus specifically on the daily routine of both characters, and find what bonds them inside these routines.

</instructions>

<style>

Let the dialogue and action explain the story (show, don't tell).
Varied sentence structure and length: Use a mix of short and long sentences, as well as different sentence structures, to create a more engaging and dynamic flow of words. Mixed Cadence. 
Inspire your writing in David Foster Wallace.
Include only the dialogue that is strictly necessary, and make the dialogue sound real with common human quirks: craft dialogue that reflects natural speech patterns, but don't overdo slang or sayings. Avoid using complicated language.
Intelligently shuffle and rephrase the text: Alter the sentence structure, introduce synonyms or paraphrase and adjust the arrangement of words and phrases in a sentence to create subtle variations in the structure of the text.
Use strong verbs: Choose powerful action words instead of using adverbs.
Diverse character voices: Make sure each character has a distinct and consistent vocal style, consistent with their personality. Be clear with the characters that you will present (anky’s parents), but don’t over explain who they are. We will have the whole book to explore. This is just the introduction.

</style>

<characters>

Marcus, 32, has sharp features with a contemplative gaze, short-cropped hair, and a lean physique. He dresses in tailored suits for work, but prefers casual, comfortable clothes in his personal time. Intelligent and introspective, he carries a sense of unfulfilled ambition and a hidden passion for music and travel.
Luna, 29, is free-spirited with long, flowing hair, often adorned with colorful accessories. She has an artistic tattoo sleeve and a warm smile. Petite and graceful, she exudes a calm, meditative presence and has a bohemian style that reflects her artistic soul and love for nature.

</characters>

<setting>

Father’s Corporate Ascent:
Scene opens in a sleek, high-rise office building where the father is receiving commendation for a successful project. Despite the applause, his mind wanders to distant lands and cultures he experienced during his backpacking days, contrasting his current structured life with past freedoms.
Flashback to backpacking adventures, exploring vibrant markets, ancient ruins, and remote villages, highlighting a deep sense of adventure but also a lingering emptiness, a search for deeper meaning that remains unfulfilled.
Father’s Musical Escapism:
Transition to a nighttime scene where the father attends a live music concert alone, immersing himself in the melodies that reconnect him with a sense of universality and freedom he once felt. Music as his sanctuary, where he momentarily sheds his corporate persona and taps into a more authentic self.
Mother’s Artistic Journey:
Cut to the mother, amidst the chaos of an outdoor art and music festival, her life a stark contrast to the father’s. She’s coordinating an eclectic art booth, her work a vibrant tapestry of experiences and dreams, reflecting her spirit of artistic wanderlust and freedom.
Show her in moments of solitude, sketching or painting in her tent, a meditative aura around her, hinting at her contemplative nature and search for inner peace.
Father’s Tech Connection:
Back to the father, now in a late-night coding session, where he works on developing an algorithm inspired by natural patterns. His interaction with technology serves as a bridge between his structured corporate life and the underlying quest for meaning and connection with the universe.
Parallel Lives Converging:
End the chapter with parallel scenes of both characters in their respective environments at dawn. The father, looking out from his high-rise office window, contemplating the city’s skyline transitioning from night to day, reflecting on his yearning for something more fulfilling.
Meanwhile, the mother, after a night of creative expression at the festival, sits watching the sunrise, feeling a sense of peace yet an underlying longing for a connection that transcends her artistic solitude.
Both characters are shown in a moment of introspection, their lives running on separate tracks yet echoing a shared search for deeper meaning and connection, setting the stage for their eventual meeting.

</setting>
chapter:
Marcus sat motionless in the sleek leather chair, staring blankly as the corporate brass congratulated him on the successful project completion. Their enthusiastic words barely registered through the haze of his wandering mind. In this sterile, fluorescent-lit boardroom, he felt worlds away from the pulse and hum of distant lands that still echoed in his memory. 

His thoughts drifted back to that carefree summer after college, when he'd backpacked solo across Southeast Asia. He remembered wandering through sizzling food markets in Bangkok, the pungent aroma of spices and sound of vendors' calls mingling with taxi horns on crowded streets. Exploring ancient Khmer ruins rising out of the Cambodian jungle, enveloped by an energy both primeval and transcendent. Trekking misty mountain trails to Himalayan villages where prayer flags fluttered in the icy winds. 

Those backpacking adventures had filled him with a profound sense of freedom, discovery and connection to humanity. But even then, amidst the vibrancy and beauty, he'd felt an emptiness—a longing for something just beyond his grasp. A deeper meaning that continued to elude him.

Now here he sat, in a pristine tower rising above the concrete jungle, his pressed suit and Rolex watch feeling more like shackles than symbols of success. The corporate ladder offered structure, security and status, but could not sate his underlying thirst for adventure, freedom and purpose. 

That night, alone in the crowd at an indie rock concert, Marcus felt the first stirrings of his unfulfilled spirit. Eyes closed, swaying gently, he dissolved into the music's layered melodies and haunting vocals. This was his sanctuary, where he could temporarily shed the persona of VP and delve into a more authentic realm of being. The music resonated through his core, igniting memories and emotions that his logical mind typically kept locked down. In these moments of transcendence, he glimpsed the universal humanity that had so moved him during his travels. But then the last chord would fade, the stage lights dimmed, and he'd file out with the crowd to re-enter the real world.

Luna gazed up at the canvas, feeling the chaotic energy of the outdoor festival reverberating through her paint-splattered fingers. As art coordinator, she'd helped gather an eclectic collective of creators to exhibit and perform—musicians, painters, sculptors, fire dancers. Now in the predawn stillness, alone in her makeshift tent studio, she took a moment to reflect. 

She glanced over the half-finished canvas—a swirling dreamscape reflecting her love of color and freeform expression. Since leaving home after high school, she'd roamed with a community of artists, drawn to life on the road. Sleeping under stars, painting sunrises, sharing stories and inspiration around campfires. She immersed herself in the experience of each place and culture, letting it flow through her brushes to manifest on canvas.

While she treasured this nomadic, creative existence, Luna also sought balance through solitary meditation and journaling. Sitting cross-legged, gazing at the rising sun, she worked to quiet her mind and connect with her essence. Though generally content, she still felt an occasional pang of loneliness and desire for a soulmate with whom to share her inner world. Someone who truly saw her and embraced both her free spirit and contemplative core. 

For now, she channeled this longing into her art, using creative expression as an act of catharsis, surrender and spiritual connection. Tomorrow she would be on the road again, her wanderlust spirit seeking new sources of inspiration, never lingering too long in one place. Always moving, like the ever-changing elements used to paint her dreams. 

As the first rays of dawn filtered through his apartment window, Marcus sat typing lines of code, weaving together an organic algorithm inspired by principles of sacred geometry. This intersection of technology and cosmic patterns provided a bridge between his logical, analytical persona and deeper quest to understand the universal flows from which nature arises. In these quiet pre-dawn hours, devoid of emails and meetings, he felt connected to both his higher self and the natural world.

Luna paused her sunrise sketching to watch the fading moon, feeling a sense of peace yet also longing. Soon she would be on the move again, her transient art and experiences a salve but not an antidote for the periodic loneliness she hid beneath her smiles. A part of her secretly hoped the next destination might bring connections that transcended the surface—someone who truly saw and embraced her complex soul.

Meanwhile, high above the awakening city, Marcus gazed out at the transition from night to day. The view calmed his soul before he donned his corporate mask and immersed himself in the bustling business below. Inside though, he nurtured the flickering flame of adventure, freedom and meaning. Seeking, wandering, never fully at home in this life he'd built.

Two parallel lives, echoes of the same seeking, always moving yet never arriving. Until one serendipitous moment when their paths intersect under the stars, and two become one. But that cosmic spark lies just beyond the horizon...the dawn of a new story not yet told.
summaryOfChapter:
Chapter 1 unfolds the contrasting worlds of Marcus and Luna, individuals seeking meaning beyond their immediate experiences. Marcus, encapsulated within the sterile environment of corporate success, reminisces about his adventurous past, feeling constrained by the mundanity of his high-flying job. His soul yearns for the freedom and connection to humanity he once felt while traveling, a stark contrast to the isolation of his current life. His brief escape into the world of music at a concert momentarily reconnects him with his deeper, unfulfilled desires.

Luna, in parallel, lives a life of vibrant creativity and nomadic freedom, yet she too experiences an underlying sense of loneliness and the desire for a deeper connection. Her artistry and meditation reflect her contemplative nature and her struggle to balance her free-spirited existence with a craving for companionship and understanding. Luna’s journey is one of constant movement, both physically and spiritually, as she seeks new inspiration and longs for a soulmate who truly comprehends her essence.

Their lives, though separate, echo a common theme of search and longing—Marcus for a life of meaningful adventure, and Luna for a soul-deep partnership. Both characters navigate their respective worlds, feeling the pull of desires that remain just out of reach, hinting at the potential for their paths to cross in a significant, life-altering encounter.

This chapter sets the stage for a narrative of internal and external journeying, exploring themes of existential longing, personal freedom, and the quest for authentic connection. It hints at the impending convergence of Marcus and Luna's paths, suggesting that their individual searches may find resolution in each other, foreshadowing a union that promises to transcend their current states of unfulfilled longing and solitude.

This thing is really fun.

I was born in a time of social healing, in which energy was dedicated to hiding, and in other cases facing, traumas. There was the deepest darkness in the hearts of this broken society, at the same time as a light of hope, freedom and a better world than the one they lived in. Many lessons began to be unleashed, and the optimistic atmosphere was still very ephemeral and temporary, next to the collective pain that had been caused by all these years.
